Gibson JunxunLevel 3. WonderkidUpdated on 07 Jun 2019It’ll depend on what is your end goal to your investments, if you’re looking at hedgling against inflation, then SSBs is probably one of the best ways to hedge against inflation. However do note that bonds in general is like lending people money for a period of time  and you get compensated with regular interest rate. It’s is not something that will grow over time like businesses or REITS or ETFs. It’s like a coupon that allows you to claim your money back after a period of time.if you’re looking to grow your money, then setting aside a small portion of your money into bonds so that you have your back covered then you can proceed to grow your money with the other investment instruments out there.Wishing you a wonderful investing journey ahead!1 comment2
